page.title: 02Carter's Bridge Fm:Chatteris
page.content: The area around Chatteris is excellent for farming and prices can reach{Â£4000 per acre. This is a large tenant farm of{900}acres although there are a number of smaller farms in the area. The crops in acres are{wheat(500); {sugarbeet(150); potatoes(110);}dwarf French beans(80); carrots(30) and peas (20). There is a five_year rotation which helps to prevent fungal disease. The sugarbeet, green beans and carrots are supplied by contract to firms such as British Sugar and Ross Foods. The wheat, potatoes and peas are sold on the open market. Most of the potatoes go to make chips. Since the farm was taken over in 1969, every acre has been{drained}with 10cm clay pipes which discharge into the nearby river. In summer the soil dries out quickly so the potato crop has to be{irrigated.
